seo.h1_title: Tuscany & Liguria Combo: Florence, Cinque Terre & The Tuscan Coast
seo.intro_paragraph: Dive into Florence and the intensity of the Renaissance before following the Chianti hills and their golden vineyards. Approach Volterra and its Etruscan walls, cross rampart-girt Monteriggioni, then trace the suspended villages of Cinque Terre to the peaceful port of La Spezia.
seo.seo_hook: Vineyard hills plunging toward turquoise seas, medieval towers piercing clouds. Tuscany sings romance, Cinque Terre whispers poetry.

itineraries.title: Trieste & The Karst: Habsburg Caf√©s, Miramare Castle & Prosecco Hills

visits.text: Risiera di San Sabba - unique Nazi concentration camp with crematorium in Italy, national monument
Muggia - only Istrian locality that remained Italian, 14 km from Capodistria in Slovenia
Historic center of Muggia - picturesque alleys, medieval Duomo and castle overlooking the port

activities.text: Visit to the Civico Museo della Risiera di San Sabba - poignant testimony to tragic history
Discovery of the cella della morte and the execution sites of the camp
Crossing by Delfino Verde ferry from Trieste to Muggia
Walk on the molo and in the calli of the historic center of Muggia
Swimming at Lido di Muggia or on the nearby Slovenian Istrian beaches

visits.text: Piazza Unit√† d'Italia - one of the largest squares in Europe open to the sea, 12,000 m¬≤ facing the gulf
Fontana dei Quattro Continenti - monumental fountain in the center of the main square
Palazzo del Governo - Liberty style palace dominating the square
Molo Audace - panoramic pier of 240 m extending into the Gulf of Trieste
Teatro Romano - ancient theater from the 1st century that could accommodate 3,500 spectators, at the foot of Colle di San Giusto
Arco di Riccardo - Roman arch from the 1st century BC, former gate of the Forum, embedded between houses
Castello di San Giusto - fortress dominating the city with museum, 14th century chapel and walkways
Cattedrale di San Giusto Martire - Romanesque cathedral with splendid Byzantine mosaics from the 12th-13th centuries
Lungomare di Barcola - 5 km promenade along the sea with sunbathing platforms called topette
Faro della Vittoria - lighthouse-monument of 68 m dedicated to the fallen of the Great War, with Vittoria Alata at the top
Castello di Miramare - 19th century residence of Archduke Maximilian of Habsburg facing the gulf
Opicina - panoramic plateau at the gates of Trieste with spectacular view over the gulf
Belvedere Obelisco di Opicina - commanding viewpoint with starting point for trails in the Carso
Grotta Gigante - one of the largest tourist caves in Europe, chamber 100 m high

activities.text: Coffee break at Caff√® degli Specchi - historic caf√© with view over the square and its palaces
Sunset from Molo Audace - spectacular panorama over the gulf
Walk in Borgo Teresiano - elegant 18th century district with neoclassical palaces
Canal Grande and Ponte Rosso - navigable canal with statue of James Joyce on the bridge
Climb via Scala dei Giganti - monumental panoramic staircase to Colle di San Giusto
Walk in Parco della Rimembranza - memorial park dedicated to the caduti of the First World War
Visit to Piazza Hortis - botanical garden with statue of Italo Svevo and Biblioteca Civica
Discovery of Giardino di Via San Michele - secret garden with waterfall and view over the city center rooftops
Palazzo della Borsa and Fontana del Nettuno - neoclassical palace and sculpted 18th-century fountain
Climb the 285 steps of Faro della Vittoria for panoramic view over the gulf
Visit to Miramare castle - period interiors and tragic history of Maximilian and Charlotte
Walk in Miramare botanical park - 22 hectares with Sentiero di Massimiliano
Swimming or snorkeling in the marine protected area around the castle
Discovery of the Barcolana - famous international regatta in October from the lungomare
Ride on Tram di Opicina - historic tramway from 1902 with panoramic rack railway section
Guided tour of Grotta Gigante - 500-step route down and back up, 2 hours
Exploration of giant concretions and millennial columns in the cave
Hiking on the Carso trails from Opicina towards the war bunkers
Stop at an osmiza - typical rural tavern of the Carso for local wines and regional products

visits.text: Sistiana - bay with turquoise and crystal-clear waters nestled in the Carso, beaches and marina
Sentiero Rilke - 1.7 km panoramic path on the cliffs between Sistiana and Castello di Duino
Carso triestino - limestone plateau with white rocks, caves and vineyards between sea and mountain

activities.text: Swimming in Sistiana bay with crystal-clear waters ranging from turquoise to deep blue
Hiking on the Sentiero Rilke - spectacular views over the gulf from the cliffs
Exploration of Val Rosandra - wild valley with waterfalls, streams and Roman remains
Swimming in the natural pools of the Rosandra stream in summer
Discovery of the Carso villages: Prosecco, Basovizza, Sgonico and their osmize

visits.text: Postojna Caves - 24 km karst network with underground train, one of the most beautiful caves in Europe
Predjama Castle - spectacular medieval castle built into a 123 m high cliff

activities.text: Day trip from Trieste to Slovenian caves and castle
Small train ride through the underground galleries of Postojna with fairy-like concretions
Visit to Predjama Castle - 12th century troglodyte fortress and its secret passages
Discovery of the legend of the brigand knight Erazem who resisted sieges from this hideout
Return via Lipica - historic stud farm of white Lipizzan horses since the 16th century

seo.h1_title: Trieste & The Karst: Habsburg Caf√©s, Miramare Castle & Prosecco Hills
seo.intro_paragraph: Take your time in Trieste, between imperial heritage and coffee culture, then follow the coast to Miramare Castle facing the Adriatic. Pause at Muggia, a fishing village with lively lanes, before reaching Sistiana and its limestone landscapes. Here, sea air and Mitteleuropa elegance blend effortlessly.
seo.seo_hook: Habsburg squares echoing grandeur, Miramare castle overlooking the sea, coffee rituals unchanged. Trieste, Mitteleuropean soul.

itineraries.title: Umbria, Italy Medieval Journey: Hilltop Villages, Wine and Spiritual Sanctuaries

visits.text: Duomo di Orvieto - Gothic cathedral with monumental facade adorned with golden mosaics and sculpted bas-reliefs
Pozzo di San Patrizio - Renaissance well 50 meters deep lit by 70 large windows, double helical staircase
Orvieto Sotterranea - underground network of galleries and caves carved into the tuff beneath the upper city

activities.text: Exploration of Etruscan and medieval remains of the city perched on its tuff spur
Panoramic viewpoint over the valley from the central well

visits.text: Rocca Albornoz - imposing medieval fortress dominating the city from a hill
Centro storico - medieval village with stone arches, fountains and silent squares
Narni Sotterranea - underground complex including crypt, Roman cistern and Inquisition torture chamber

activities.text: Guided tour of the hypogea discovered under the San Domenico convent
Swimming in the Mole di Narni - natural pool with emerald waters formed by the Nera river

visits.text: Borgo di Castelluccio - hilltop village at 1450m overlooking the vast karst plateau of the Piani
Piana di Castelluccio - high plateau surrounded by the Sibillini Mountains in the heart of the national park

activities.text: Observation of the spectacular blooming of lentils and wildflowers (late May-July)
Hiking on the trails of Parco Nazionale dei Monti Sibillini
Tasting of lenticchie di Castelluccio IGP grown at 1500m altitude

visits.text: Borgo dei Ruscelli - village crossed by channels and small waterfalls fed by the Capovena spring
Medieval alleyways - stone passages spanning the waterways in a fairy-tale atmosphere

activities.text: Walk along the torrents that wind between the stone houses
Contemplation of water features and waterfalls in the heart of the village

visits.text: Historic center of Spello - village with flower-lined alleys and pink and yellow stone houses at the foot of Monte Subasio
Chiesa di Santa Maria Maggiore - church housing the Cappella Baglioni with Renaissance frescoes by Pinturicchio
Roman gates - remains of the ancient entrance gates of the Roman city

activities.text: Stroll through the vicoli decorated with flowers and climbing plants
Discovery of the Infiorate - elaborate flower carpets during Corpus Domini in June

visits.text: Chiesa-Museo di San Francesco - former church converted into a museum with fresco cycle on the life of Saint Francis
Piazza del Comune - circular square in the center of the village where all the main streets converge
Medieval ramparts - fortified walls offering panorama over the vineyards and olive groves

activities.text: Tasting of Sagrantino di Montefalco DOCG in the wine cellars of the territory

visits.text: Piazza Silvestri - asymmetrical medieval square with oblique perspectives, unique example of Umbrian urban planning
Chiesa di San Michele Arcangelo - Romanesque church with stone facade and sculpted portal
Chiesa di San Silvestro - austere Romanesque church facing the main square
Palazzo dei Consoli - Gothic communal palace with monumental external staircase
Cinta muraria - almost entirely preserved medieval walls surrounding the village

activities.text: Walk through the cobbled streets of the preserved historic center

visits.text: Mura etrusche - remains of Etruscan walls surrounding the village perched on its hill
Belvedere - panoramic viewpoint over Assise, Foligno, Spello and the entire Umbrian valley
Centro storico - maze of pedestrian alleyways in the heart of the village of Etruscan origin

activities.text: Exploration of alleyways accessible only on foot
Contemplation of the 360¬∞ panorama over the surrounding hills

visits.text: Castello Medievale di Corciano - medieval fortress housing artworks in its halls
Cinta muraria - imposing ramparts encircling the hilltop village
Centro storico - stone alleyways winding between ancient houses, olive trees and vineyards

activities.text: Walk along the fortifications with views over the Umbrian countryside

visits.text: Rocca del Leone - pentagonal medieval fortress overlooking Lake Trasimeno with crenellated towers
Palazzo della Corgna - Renaissance palace with salons decorated with Mannerist frescoes
Chiesa di Santa Maria Maddalena - parish church at the heart of the fortified village

activities.text: Walk along the shores of Lake Trasimeno with panoramic views of the islands
Ferry crossing to Isola Polvese, nature reserve in the middle of the lake

seo.h1_title: Umbria, Italy Medieval Journey: Hilltop Villages, Wine and Spiritual Sanctuaries
seo.intro_paragraph: Explore Orvieto and its Gothic cathedral set upon tuff, then reach Narni and its fortress airs. Cross the Castelluccio plateau, vast and silent, before losing yourself in Rasiglia between canals and mills. Montefalco awaits with its vines and frescoes, like a gentle synthesis of secret Umbria.
seo.seo_hook: Gothic cathedrals rising from tuff cliffs, plateaus carpeted with wildflowers, water mills drowsing. Medieval Umbria, secret and preserved.

itineraries.title: Vicenza & The Veneto: Palladio's Architecture & Berici Hills Villages

visits.text: Teatro Olimpico - oldest covered masonry theater in the world with famous Renaissance stage trompe-l'oeil, UNESCO World Heritage Site
Basilica Palladiana - palace of Reason built by Palladio in 1546 on Piazza dei Signori, masterpiece of Renaissance architecture
Palazzo Chiericati - palace built by Palladio in 1550, major example of Palladian architecture on Piazza Matteotti
Tempio di San Lorenzo - Gothic church along Corso Palladio
Villa Rotonda - famous Palladian villa with central plan and dome, located at the city gates, UNESCO World Heritage listed
Villa Valmarana Ai Nani - villa at the gates of Vicenza famous for its fresco cycle by Giambattista Tiepolo and his son Giandomenico
Palazzo Porto - unfinished work by Palladio on Piazza Castello, UNESCO World Heritage listed

activities.text: Giardini Salvi - historic gardens 500 meters from the station, ideal starting point to discover the city
Corso Palladio - main artery of the historic center lined with Renaissance palaces and monuments
Ponte di San Michele - picturesque bridge built between 1621 and 1623 spanning the Retrone river
Parco Querini - vast secular park in the heart of the city with lakes, canals, hills and tempietti
Visit to artisan workshops - discovery of ancient lithography and art printing techniques in the botteghe of the center
Colli Berici - hills south of Vicenza offering natural landscapes, cycling paths and gastronomic sagre throughout the year

visits.text: Bosco di Dueville - protected wetland among the most evocative in Veneto, resurgence site of the waters of the Bacchiglione river
Sorgenti del Bacchiglione - natural spectacle of the emergence of waters in an enchanting landscape

activities.text: Naturalist walk in the restored environment of the humid wood

visits.text: Distilleria Poli - historic distillery with visit and tasting of the house's finest grappas
Fabbrica di Ceramiche Antonibon - excellence ceramics manufacture founded at the end of the 17th century, supplier to royal courts and embassies
Villa Angarano - Venetian villa with wine tasting and local products in a historic setting

activities.text: Discovery of the secrets of traditional ceramic manufacturing in the manufacture's exhibition hall

visits.text: Villa Godi Malinverni - first villa designed by Palladio at the foot of the Altopiano di Asiago, with historic gardens open for visits
Buso della Rana - largest cave in Veneto, refreshing underground excursion ideal for families

activities.text: Guided tour of the Palladian residence and its Italian gardens
Speleological exploration in the depths of the Vicentine mountain

seo.h1_title: Vicenza & The Veneto: Palladio's Architecture & Berici Hills Villages
seo.intro_paragraph: Explore Vicenza in Andrea Palladio's footsteps, between villas and facades that tell of an architectural revolution. Stop at Dueville for a garden interlude, then step into Nove's workshops where ceramics are still shaped by hand. In Lugo di Vicenza, breathe the countryside and estates that paint a peaceful setting.
seo.seo_hook: Palladian symmetry reflecting perfection, Renaissance gardens in bloom, noble estates dotting the countryside. Vicenza, soul of architecture.
